title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Eligible
witness. A victim of or a witness to a crime who has the need for witness
protection program services. (b) Family of eligible witness. Any person related to such person within the third
degree of consanguinity or affinity; any person maintaining a sexual
relationship with such person; or any person residing in the same household
with such person. (c) Provider
agency. A partnership, corporation, association, municipality, governmental
agency, public or private organization of any character, including but not
limited to a police agency, the office of district attorney, or a
victim-witness assistance program, who provides one or more program services as
defined by this Part. (d) Program
services. Those services necessary for the prevention of intimidation and the
protection of an eligible witness which may include, but shall not be limited
to: temporary relocation, changes in employment, transportation to and from
court, moving assistance, personal protection services, temporary lodging and
support services. Program services shall also mean services provided to the
family of an eligible witness where and to the extent appropriate to achieve or
maintain their security. The provider agencies shall consider, among other
factors, whether providing witness protection program services is likely to
ensure the availability of victims or witnesses to provide information to law
enforcement in the investigation and/or prosecution of the relevant crime or
crimes. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

6171.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
